references.reason: This paper is foundational for the work presented, introducing conformal prediction under distribution shift, a key concept explored and extended in the current research.

references.paper_title: Utopia: Universally trainable optimal prediction intervals aggregation
references.reason: This paper serves as a direct inspiration, focusing on prediction interval aggregation under i.i.d. setting which the current research extends to the unsupervised domain adaptation setting.

references.paper_title: Joint distribution optimal transportation for domain adaptation
references.reason: This paper provides a crucial theoretical background and methodology for handling domain shifts, especially those involving measure-preserving transformations, a crucial aspect of the current research.

references.paper_title: Domain adaptation with regularized optimal transport
references.reason: This is another highly relevant paper by Courty et al., introducing the concept of regularized optimal transport for domain adaptation, which is conceptually related to domain alignment methods explored in the current research.
This paper provides a broad overview of transfer learning, a related field that shares conceptual similarities and methodological approaches with domain adaptation, the core focus of this paper.
